paragraphs.text:
%md
### Overview
This notebook will walk you through doing basic analysis with of the parsed Wikipedia data.  It assumes you have already parsed the Wikipedia dump and created your Parquet files.  If you have not done this then refer to the EMR-Scala-Process Wikipedia Dump notebook.

This notebook assumes you are hosting your files in S3.  Simply paste in your appropriate S3 info.  If you are having access denied errors then reference this page: [S3 EMR Permissions](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ManagementGuide/emr-iam-roles.html)

###Configure the parser
See this page to add the correct dependencies to Zeppelin:
[Wiki](https://github.com/nielsenbe/Spark-Wiki-Parser/wiki/EMR---Configure-Zeppelin)

msg.data:
Overview

This notebook will walk you through doing basic analysis with of the parsed Wikipedia data. It assumes you have already parsed the Wikipedia dump and created your Parquet files. If you have not done this then refer to the EMR-Scala-Process Wikipedia Dump notebook.

This notebook assumes you are hosting your files in S3. Simply paste in your appropriate S3 info. If you are having access denied errors then reference this page: S3 EMR Permissions

Configure the parser

See this page to add the correct dependencies to Zeppelin:
Wiki

paragraphs.text:
import main.scala.com.github.nielsenbe.sparkwikiparser.wikipedia._

// Update S3 Info
val bucketName = "bnielsenemr"
val destFolder = "wkpDb"

// Concat values
val s3 = s"s3://$bucketName/"
val destDB = s3 + destFolder + "/"

msg.data:
import main.scala.com.github.nielsenbe.sparkwikiparser.wikipedia._
bucketName: String = bnielsenemr
destFolder: String = wkpDb
s3: String = s3://bnielsenemr/
destDB: String = s3://bnielsenemr/wkpDb/

paragraphs.text:
// Load data
spark.read.parquet(destDB + "wkp_pages.parquet").createOrReplaceTempView("pages")
spark.read.parquet(destDB + "wkp_redirects.parquet").createOrReplaceTempView("redirects")
spark.read.parquet(destDB + "wkp_headers.parquet").createOrReplaceTempView("headers")
spark.read.parquet(destDB + "wkp_text.parquet").createOrReplaceTempView("text")
spark.read.parquet(destDB + "wkp_templates.parquet").createOrReplaceTempView("templates")
spark.read.parquet(destDB + "wkp_tags.parquet").createOrReplaceTempView("tags")
spark.read.parquet(destDB + "wkp_tables.parquet").createOrReplaceTempView("tables")
spark.read.parquet(destDB + "wkp_links.parquet").createOrReplaceTempView("links")

%md
###Analyze pages
We'll start with doing some basic analysis on the pages.

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql

-- Get pages with most redirects
SELECT 
    art.id, 
    art.title,
    COUNT(*) AS totalRedirects
FROM
    pages art 
JOIN 
    redirects rdr 
    ON art.id = rdr.targetPageId
GROUP BY
    art.id, 
    art.title
ORDER BY
    totalRedirects DESC
LIMIT 50

SELECT
    title,
    COUNT(*) AS headerCount
FROM

GROUP BY
    title
ORDER BY
    headerCount DESC

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql

-- Most common stub section (section that links back to main page via {{Main article}} template)
SELECT
    mainPage,
    COUNT(*) AS mainPageCount
FROM
    headers
WHERE
    mainPage IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY
    mainPag
ORDER BY
    mainPageCount DESC
LIMIT 25

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql
-- Longest Pages
SELECT
    art.id,
    art.title,
    sub.textLength
FROM
    Pages art
JOIN (
    SELECT
        parentPageId,
        SUM(LENGTH(text)) AS textLength
    FROM
        text
    GROUP BY
        parentPageId
    ) SUB
    ON  sub.parentPageId = art.id
WHERE
    art.pageType = 'ARTICLE'
ORDER BY
    textLength DESC
LIMIT 50

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql
-- Get Pages with most citation needed templates
SELECT
    art.id,
    art.title,
    COUNT(*) AS citationNeededCount
FROM
    page art
JOIN
    templates tmp
    ON tmp.parentPageId = art.id
WHERE
    UPPER(tmp.templateType) = 'CITATION NEEDED'
GROUP BY
    art.id,
    art.title
ORDER BY
    citationNeededCount DESC
LIMIT 25

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql
-- Get longest tables
SELECT
    art.id,
    art.title,
    tbl.caption,
    LENGTH(html) AS tableLength
FROM
    pages art
JOIN
    tables tbl
    ON tbl.parentPageId = art.id
WHERE
    art.pageType = 'ARTICLE'
ORDER BY
    tableLength DESC
LIMIT 25
